alert.note: Alert for Jones; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:04PM CDT until May 12 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN JONES AND NORTHEASTERN TAYLOR COUNTIES... At 1001 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rain across Abilene. 1.23 inches have fallen at the Abilene airport at 10 PM CDT. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen...with the heavier amounts in the cente of Abilene. Additional but lighter rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area through midnight. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Abilene, Tye, Dyess Afb, Hamby and Impact. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 276 and 292. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Curry Lane from Clack Street to Catclaw Drive, Texas Avenue at Arnold Boulevard, Butternut Underpass, Intersections along Sammons Street, South 27th Street at Catclaw Creek, 2000 block of Oak Street, Intersections along South 25th Street, Intersections along Vogel Street, FM 3308 crossing Draw and North 6th Street and Willis. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
